note: Data is expressed in constant 2015 US$.
title: Material footprint per gross domestic product
subtitle: Material footprint is the amount of material needed to meet a country's demand. It is material production, adjusted for trade. The total material footprint is the sum of the material footprint for biomass, fossil fuels, metal ores, and non-metal ores. It is given in kg per $ of [GDP](#dod:gdp).
